candidates.title: Bump version.
candidates.body: Related #607

candidates.title: Migrate to Tokio 0.2
candidates.body:
Motivated to migrate RLS off Tokio 0.1 for IPC transport but since we're at it, it might make sense to migrate everything else in one fell swoop.

~This is a very early draft but opening it now to prevent duplicating work in case someone else starts working in it (or would like to help :grin:).~

Fixes #582
Fixes #485

candidates.title: update parking_lot to v0.11
candidates.body: Signed-off-by: koushiro <koushiro.cqx@gmail.com>

candidates.title: Update `local` client to support middleware (Kudos Seun)
candidates.body:
Previously the `jsonrpc_core_client::transports::local::connect` consumed a `Deref<Target=MetaIoHandler<TMetadata, NoopMiddleware>>`,

This PR corrects that behaviour allowing the local transport support other `Middleware` implementations

candidates.title: Use patched ws-rs
candidates.body: Revert to `ws-rs` once https://github.com/housleyjk/ws-rs/pull/328 is merged and published.

candidates.title: Use patched ws-rs
candidates.body: Revert to `ws-rs` once https://github.com/housleyjk/ws-rs/pull/328 is merged and published.

candidates.title: Resolve possible trait import conflict.
candidates.body: Since we do two glob imports, if there is `Future` trait imported (from `futures03`) in the upper scope the client generation breaks.

candidates.title: Remove failure dependency.
candidates.body: Resolves #578

candidates.title: Migrate core to futures=0.3
candidates.body:
This is the first step towards #485 (also see #422). The PR rewrites `jsonrpc-core` & `jsonrpc-derive` & `jsonrpc-core-client` (but not transports) to be compatible with `futures=0.3`.

`jsonrpc-derive` is limited to return either `Result<_>` or `BoxFuture<Result<_>>` (see `WrapFuture` trait), supporting custom future types would require a bit more work. Actually it would be best to check out if we can integrate it with `async_trait`, so that the implementations can simply define `async` functions.

The transports (servers) currently run the futures in `compat` mode, they should be updated as well.

candidates.title: Bump `derive` version to v14.2.1
candidates.body: It'd be nice to have a release with #558 included. I missed it earlier, so it didn't make it into 14.2.

candidates.title: Bump quote crate version
candidates.body:
There was an issue with quote v1.0.2 which is why
we were pinned to v1.0.1. This issue has been fixed
so we don't need to be pinned anymore.

candidates.title: Add a subscription manager
candidates.body:
I was implementing some pubsub APIs in Substrate, outside of `sc-rpc`, and got to a point where I needed something to execute the subscription Futures. There's nothing provided out of the box for doing that, so after talking with @tomusdrw we figured that it might be useful to have the [Substrate subscription manager](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/blob/master/client/rpc-api/src/subscriptions.rs) be a part of the `pubsub` crate.

What I've done is I've stolen that code and changed it to try and be a little less opinionated. One concern I have though is that I've changed `SubscriptionId` to now take a generic parameter, `N`, to avoid only working with `u64` ids, and I think this will break people's code.

I'm looking for feedback on whether the general approach is alright, and if the change to `SubscriptionId` is acceptable.

candidates.title: 14.1.0 bump
candidates.body:
## Release notes

- Wait for http server to close on Drop. (#543)
- Add "Accept:application/json" header for all requests. (#544) 
- Client call with named params (#541)

candidates.title: Client call with named params
candidates.body:
# Add named_params option to RPC derive macro

Closes #540 

While the server generated by the derive macro doesn't support calling functions with named params some other systems do (some exclusively). It would still be nice to use the clean derive macro syntax to generate a client in this case.

This PR adds a flag `named_params` to the rpc method attribute. Example:
```rust
#[rpc(name = "add", named_params)]
fn add(&self, a: u32, b: u32) -> Result<String>;
```
In this case the json-rpc call object produced by calling the generated method on a client will have a params object that takes the key names from the function parameter names.
```json
{
   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
   "params": {"a": 4, "b": 2},
   ...
}
```

As the server doesn't support this it is important that this cannot be used when deriving server RPC methods. The rpc derive macro will throw a compile time error if the `named_params` switch is used in any case other than `#[rpc(client)]`. See (derive/tests/ui/attr-named-params-on-server.rs)

candidates.title: Bump parity-tokio-ipc
candidates.body: The new version compiles on android 😅

candidates.title: 14.0.5 bump
candidates.body:
Release notes:
1. Regular updates (env_logger 0.6->0.7, websocket 0.23->0.24)
2. IPC socket permissioning (https://github.com/paritytech/jsonrpc/pull/519)
3. Support `serde_json` with `arbitrary_precision` feature.
4. Modify the HTTP server requests handling (avoid `buffer_unordered` with aribtrary limit in favour of spawning tasks on the runtime).

candidates.title: workaround serde deserializing incorrectly when arbitrary_precision enabled
candidates.body:
serde deserializes incorrectly when arbitrary precision is enabled.

fixes #520 

The workaround is to deserialize into `Value` before `ClientResponse`. This is gated under the feature `arbitrary_precision` in core-client and `transports`.

candidates.title: Upgrade parity-tokio-ipc
candidates.body: The newest version of the library supports using `SecurityAttributes` for setting socket permissions on *nix.

candidates.body: Fixes: #514

candidates.title: Bump version.
candidates.body: CC @niklasad1

candidates.title: Update syn & co
candidates.body: Closes #505

candidates.title: ignore dropped connections
candidates.body:
Previously If there's no `peer_addr` on the socket, this causes the tcp-server to panic. 

https://github.com/paritytech/jsonrpc/blob/44184766aeb59a95b4d6f4c7eaff0c9e1ef278eb/tcp/src/server.rs#L87-L93

Instead of panicking this PR instead ignores the connection as it has most likely been dropped by the client.

closes #500

candidates.title: Bump to 14.0
candidates.body:
I believe that #495 was quite a significant change and it deserves a major version bump.

Even though technically the threading behaviour was buggy, updating to post #495 will cause a huge change in perceived performance (as by default it would run less threads).

candidates.title: Fix threading and closing of servers
candidates.body:
This PRs attempts to clean up the spawned threads (Closes #425).
Currently every `RpcEventLoop` spawns a bunch of threads that depend on the number of cores (tokio runtime) + one thread that waits for the runtime to complete. Instead we just spawn `tokio::runtime` with one thread and a right name.

Also we avoid calling `tokio::spawn` when handling incoming connections in various server implementations to ensure that when the server is closed all connections are dropped as well (currently, they are still being polled by the runtime so you have to wait for them to close or timeout).

Updates the requirements on [env_logger](https://github.com/sebasmagri/env_logger) to permit the latest version.

We may change this in patch versions, but will always flag it in the release notes here. > > You can always check the `.travis.yml` file to see the current minimum supported version. > > # Contributions > > - [@​95ulisse](https://github.com/95ulisse) [Indentation for multiline log messages](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/134) > - [@​oherrala](https://github.com/oherrala) [Add more timestamp precisions](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/140) > - [Update to 2018 edition](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sebasmagri/env_logger/pull/142)

candidates.title: Add `iter` and `IntoIterator` to `IoHandler`
candidates.body: Context: To be able to get all methods current in `IoHandler` and add a "meta" call that returns all available methods.
